title: Griddled za’atar flatbreads
time: Hands on time 35-40 min, plus proving
description: These simple za’atar flatbreads are really easy to make. Just 30 minutes proving, then they’re ready to griddle in a hot pan. Serve with tagines, houmous or slow-roast lamb.
ingredients: 300g white bread flour, plus extra to dust
2-3 large baking trays dusted with flour
Large heavy-based frying pan or griddle pan

method.Step 1: Whisk the yeast, warm water and a spoonful of the flour in a bowl until the yeast dissolves. Leave the bowl in a warm place for a few minutes until frothy.

method.Step 2: Put the remaining flour and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre, pour in the yeast mixture and olive oil and combine to form a soft dough. Knead for 5 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover the bowl with a clean tea towel and set aside for 30 minutes.

method.Step 3: Divide the dough into 8 equal pieces and shape each into a ball. Flour the work surface, take a ball and flatten it with your hands to form a round. Using a rolling pin, roll out the dough to form a thin round about 20cm across. Scatter with a little za’atar and roll again to press it into the dough. Set aside on a lightly floured tray while you shape the remaining flatbreads.

method.Step 4: Heat the frying/griddle pan over a high heat. Cook the flatbreads one at a time, for about 1 minute on each side, until puffed and golden. Wrap in a clean tea towel and keep warm (see Make Ahead) until ready to serve.
